text: My personal favorite Castlevania game of all time.

text: @TheWardogEX Totally : it's undoubtedly one of the best soundtracks ever.
author: bibaxbib

text: @SupraDarky  I think Dark Souls has equivalent experience as old school plus Metroidvania era. To think the game mostly required your skill and perception more than character's stats point like old school one. but the layout and non-linear exploring to find item and grinding sometime improve your chance to survive like Metroidvania. It's not so exaggerate to say Dark Souls is the new generation Castlevania. and the reboot Castlevania is somehow just a God of War Clone.
author: Arch4321

text: This game is within my top 5 all time fave SNES games.
author: NYCrazyRob

text: this is the best castlevania that i have ever played, the music was fantastic and the ending theme gave you a sense of accomplishment, seriously. what a great game for its time, its so underrated
author: kunio18

text: @pipedreamsam I find it very easy. Only died ~20 times. Maybe because I played Demons Souls so much but I was disappointed.
author: Cloud

text: The very first time I ever finished this was during a live internet stream. That boss rush, at the end, was a pain in the butt and, I think, took me an hour just on it's own. Hearing this song was a grand reward for all that hardship!

text: @SupraDarky that feeling when you first beat SCIV and the credits start to roll, such an overwhelming feeling of accomplishment.

text: @SupraDarky Thats EXACTLY the way I feel about Dark Souls. I remember a while ago you posted the Great Grey Wolf Syf battle music and said you were gonna try it and somehow I knew you'd like it. text: @electricmastro Yeah. The game is insanely hard and rewarding.
author: Molten_

text: I'm thankful that I still have this game and play it to this very day.  Still one of my all time favorite games.  It is hands down the best OST on the SNES in my opinion.  It's a shame that we will never have a generation of games as great as the ones that were put out in the late 80's to early 90's...they will never be duplicated.
author: Lord Tepes

text: @dunder567 It's true I think the audience of today is full of youth who don't fully understand the complications of a game. Hence why we always hear five year olds who scream into there mics because of their fails. Games like Castlevaina and Dark souls show that you can make a game that teaches you more then frustrates you. I wasn't really a big fan of dark souls but I can say it did remind me of Castlevaina. In a good way.
author: 77winkster
77winkster

text: Is it safe to say that this game has a flawless soundtrack?
author: Wardog 1991

text: @SupraDarky It's weird that you say that because I was just playing the original Castlevania and was thinking how similar it is to Dark Souls and Demon's Souls - especially the way both games encourage you to find effective solutions to beat the level design and learn from your mistakes. It's a shame they don't make many games that reach that level of challenge and satisfaction.
author: Reggie Nintendo

text: @SupraDarky People don't make games like they used to, but is Dark Souls an exception?
author: electricmastro

text: Man. this SNES music is so GOOD
author: OmegasMovie

text: I finished Dark Souls an hour ago and it might end up being one of my favorite games of all time. I absolutely loved it. In a way, Dark Souls is the modern equivalent of the experience I had with the old school Castlevania games as a kid. Dark and gloomy atmosphere, alone against what seems insurmountable odds, and an awesome feeling of accomplishment when you succeed. I find this track fits perfectly that sense of accomplishment.
author: SupraDarky
